009package GenericFilterDemos;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
017import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.Kernel1D;
018import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.Kernel2D;
019import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
020import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilterSeparable;
021
022
023/**
024 * This ImageJ plugin shows how to construct a generic linear filter
025 * based on classes {@link LinearFilter} and {@link Kernel2D}.
026 * This plugin works for all types of images.
027 * On RGB color images, the filter is applied independently
028 * to the three color channels.
029 * The active image is modified.
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/03/30
033 * 
034 * @see LinearFilter
035 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
036 * @see GenericFilter
037 * @see Kernel2D
038 * @see GaussianKernel1D
039 */
040public class Gaussian_Filter_Separable implements PlugInFilter {
041        
042        static double SIGMA = 7.5;
043
044    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
045        return DOES_ALL;
046    }
047
048    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
049        IJ.log("sigma = " + SIGMA);
050                Kernel1D kernel = new GaussianKernel1D(SIGMA);
051                GenericFilter filter = new LinearFilterSeparable(kernel);
052                filter.applyTo(ip);
053    }
054
055}
